poem:
Title: In the Theatre of the Body

In the workshop of flesh,
stories stutter to life on the treadmill.
Seven figures sculpted by Eve's pen,
moles on their aching joints,
carry the weight of the world.
Sweat-polished dramas,
echoed in mirrors and barbell clangs,
Exercising both heart and art,
a play that leaves us panting,
to feel the entire cosmos
in someone else's hamstring.
